title: (x) Baseball-style christmas card script - Fulton Sign Script {Lex}
content:
Hello, could you please point me to that script font, thank you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130416001336im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mcahny__4981.gif)
author: Alessandro Segalini

comments.content:
Mike Y's guide has this listed as Fulton Sign Script (aka Ebor Script aka Sweden aka Sedona Script). [Ebor Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20130416001336/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=418095) can be found here, although the 'p' looks slightly different.

- Lex

[This thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20130416001336/http:/typophile.com/node/5400) gives more information about the typeface, as well as another alternate, [Philly Sport Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20130416001336/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=UR.116248.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Happy+New+Year&sampleSize=48) (although its 'p' is also different, and looks completely out of place).

- Lex

Letterhead's Ballpark is pretty close as well  
 [http://letterheadfonts.com/contributors/tomkennedy/ballpark.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20130416001336/http:/letterheadfonts.com/contributors/tomkennedy/ballpark.shtml "http://letterheadfonts.com/contributors/tomkennedy/ballpark.shtml")
